properties.Name: PolicyPremiumFactor
properties.Description:
The factors involved in calculated the associated Policy Premium.

Three primary factors are considered when computing the basic premium for life insurance:

(1)  Mortality

A mortality table indicates the expectation of life at given ages and the probability of death.

(2)  Interest

An insurer assumes that a specific net rate of interest will be earned on all its investments and that one full year's interest will be earned by each premium policyholders pay.

(3)  Expense

The expense factors of the insurer are computed and included in premium rates.
These are sometimes called 'Loading Charges'.

Additional factors considered include:

- Sex
- Interest Factor
- Expense Factor
- Health
- Lifestyle
- Occupation
- Age

Columns.Name: ProductId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a Product.

Columns.Name: PremiumFactorId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a Premium Factor.

Columns.Name: SubstandardRiskAssessmentMethodId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a Substandard Risk Assessment Method.

Columns.Name: RiskClassificationId
Columns.Description: The unique identifier of a Risk Classification.

Columns.Name: PeriodStartDate
Columns.Description: The period start date for which the premium table is calculated.

Columns.Name: PeriodEndDate
Columns.Description: The period end date for which the premium table is calculated.

Columns.Name: FactorRating
Columns.Description: The factor rating determined for the associated Premium Factor.

Columns.Name: PremiumFactorAmount
Columns.Description: The amount of increase in the insurance policy premium if the associated Premium Factor and Factor Rating are applied.

Columns.Name: PremiumFactorPercentage
Columns.Description: The percentage of increase in the insurance policy premium if the associated Premium Factor and Factor Rating are applied.

Columns.Name: FactorNote
Columns.Description: Notes, comments or additional information regarding the assignment of the Premium Factor.
